author: PetSerAl
body:
When you pass `ScriptBlock` as parameter to native application, PowerShell activate so called MiniShell mode, where it encode script block and arguments as suitable for PowerShell subprocess call. When script block is empty, it generate incorrect command line.
It also looks like `-encodedCommand` parameter does not support empty string as its input.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
.\powershell -command {}
cmd /c echo -command {}
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none

-encodedCommand "" -inputFormat xml -outputFormat text
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Cannot process the command because the value specified with -EncodedCommand is not properly encoded. The value must be Base64 encoded.
#PowerShell help
-encodedCommand  -inputFormat xml -outputFormat text
```

title: Passing script block to native application generate wrong value for -encodedCommand parameter
